meanings.definition: In a way that indicates completion or perfection.
meanings.sent1: She cleaned her room perfectively, making sure every corner was spotless.
meanings.sent2: He painted the picture perfectively, adding the final touches to make it flawless.
meanings.sent3: The chef cooked the dish perfectively, ensuring it was a masterpiece of flavors.
meanings.sent4: The student answered the exam questions perfectively, achieving a perfect score.
meanings.sent5: The dancer moved across the stage perfectively, executing each step with precision.

meanings.definition: To make something perfect or complete.
meanings.sent1: They perfectively decorated the cake for the party, adding colorful frosting and sprinkles.
meanings.sent2: The architect perfectively designed the building, paying attention to every detail.
meanings.sent3: The team perfectively assembled the puzzle, fitting each piece together with care.
meanings.sent4: She perfectively organized her schedule, ensuring she had time for all her tasks.
meanings.sent5: He perfectively polished his speech, rehearsing it multiple times to deliver it flawlessly.
